001
002package com.commercetools.docs.meta;
003
004import com.fasterxml.jackson.annotation.JacksonAnnotation;
005
006import io.vrap.rmf.base.client.ApiMethod;
007
008/**
009 * <h2 id=general-concept>General concept of the SDK</h2>
010 *
011 * The SDK provides classes and interfaces to interact with the commercetools APIs in an object oriented way.
012 *
013 * <h3>ApiHttpClient</h3>
014 *
015 * The {@link io.vrap.rmf.base.client.ApiHttpClient} defines the interface to interact with the API. It executes requests
016 * and maps the response to the correct class and returns it. The ApiHttpClient supports multiple different HTTP client
017 * implementations and can the behavior can be adjusted using {@link io.vrap.rmf.base.client.http.Middleware middlewares}.
018 *
019 * <h3>ApiRoot & ProjectApiRoot</h3>
020 *
021 * The {@link com.commercetools.api.client.ApiRoot} and {@link com.commercetools.api.client.ProjectApiRoot} provide a way
022 * to explore the functionality of the API while coding. All endpoints are reachable using the chainable calls from
023 * the API root as like as the URI hierarchy of the API describes them. All request builder instances are immutable.
024 *
025 * <h3>ApiMethod</h3>
026 *
027 * For every resource endpoint and HTTP method a specific {@link io.vrap.rmf.base.client.ApiMethod} exists. It specifies
028 * the request type and the response return type. Also these classes define methods for the possible query parameters.
029 * The `with` methods set the parameter to the specified value and drop already defined ones. The `add` methods will
030 * add an additional parameter with the specified value. The ApiMethod classes are immutable.
031 *
032 * The {@link ApiMethod#execute()} and {@link ApiMethod#executeBlocking()} can be used to directly execute the request
033 * using the configured ApiHttpClient. {@link ApiMethod#send()} and {@link ApiMethod#sendBlocking()} will execute the
034 * request and return the response as byte array instead of mapping it.
035 *
036 * <h3>Models</h3>
037 *
038 * Each domain model is defined as an interface. The interface describes the getters and setters. All {@link JacksonAnnotation annotations}
039 * necessary for serializing or deserializing are defined at the interface. For each interface exists an implementation
040 * class with the suffix <i>Impl</i> and a builder class with the suffix <i>Builder</i>. The interface has factory methods
041 * for both.
042 *
043 * Additionally there is a <i>withModelName</i> method. This allows to execute a function which takes the model instance
044 * itself and maps it to a new type e.g. like type safe accessing of attribute values.
045 */
046public class GeneralConcept {
047}
